attributes.action: Improving Hyperemesis Gravidarum (HG) care in hospitals and GP practices throughout the UK
attributes.additional_details:
In june 2011 and 2014  i suffered with severe hyperemesis gravidarum.

I spent most of both pregnancies in hospital receiving care which I had to fight for and wasnt for for purpose
.

We have set up a non profit organisation (Hgwarriors) with the aim of helping hospitals improve care for ladies who suffer with HG, part of this includes better education for medical staff, and literature on HG being given to all women who suffer nausea and vomiting in pregnancy.

 We are there for petitioning for all uk GP surgeries, hospitals, midwife led birth units and maternity units to be routinely screening women for HG, providing more support and information and daily IV fluids.
